insights.rawSummary: This email chain is about an order inquiry for 5 gallons of Glycerin USP Grade (PO 1012701).  MPBio (Amber Short) is requesting an ETA and clarifying whether their FedEx account is acceptable for shipping. Alliance Chemical (Adnan Heikal) responds, stating a $50 handling fee for customer shipping accounts and that FedEx ground accounts are not accepted.  MPBio then provides their UPS account number.

insights.secondaryTopic: Request for COA and ISO certificate
insights.customerGoal: Obtain the Certificate of Analysis (COA) and ISO certificate for a product shipment
specificQuestionsAsked: Are you a distributor of other?
Please provide order number and lot number so I can get the COA sent over

problemReported.description: The customer needs a COA and ISO certificate for a product shipment, but the supplier is not ISO certified.

suggestedNextActions: Check if manufacturer's ISO certificate can be provided instead.
Request order number and lot number from James Tran.
Provide COA once order and lot numbers are received.
insights.rawSummary: James Tran requested a COA and ISO certificate from Adnan Heikal at Alliance Chemical.  Adnan initially stated that no certificate was available because Alliance Chemical is not ISO certified.  After further communication, Adnan requested the order and lot number from James to locate the COA.  The lot number provided was 70820825661860325AL.  Alliance Chemical may be able to provide the manufacturer's ISO certificate if they are a distributor.

insights.rawSummary: This email exchange concerns a request from WAP Sustainability to Alliance Chemical for updated PFAS attestation data.  Alliance Chemical initially provided a document, which was then revised to clarify whether "no added PFAS" applies to all customers or only those supplied to OBE/CRL.  The final response from Alliance Chemical indicates they have provided all necessary information.
